repnme.cdata!:
Lebanon - Ba'albeck Water and
            Wastewater Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Ba'albeck Water and
            Wastewater Project for Lebanon were as follows: outcomes
            were unsatisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            substantial, the Bank performance was moderately
            unsatisfactory, and the Borrower performance was also
            moderately unsatisfactory. There were five lessons learned:
            1) Modification of consumer behavior is a lengthy process
            that must be accounted for in the design and implementation
            of projects. 2) The implementation of political reforms is a
            complex process to which project results should be
            cautiously linked. 3) Operations in conflict environments
            require particular additional attention to the design of the
            monitoring and evaluation framework. 4) Strong and sustained
            leadership as an essential driver for institutional
            development. 5) A procurement coordinator dedicated to the
            project is essential for processing standard procedures and
            facilitating timely submissions per Bank Guidelines.

repnme.cdata!:
Lebanon - Ba'albeck Water and
            Wastewater Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Ba'albeck
            Water and Wastewater Project for Lebanon include: 1)
            developing and strengthening the capacity of the water and
            irrigation authorities; 2) improving population coverage and
            customer access to satisfactory water supply and wastewater
            services; 3) involving the private sector in the operation
            and maintenance of the water and wastewater facilities; and
            4) rationalizing the use of water by introducing water
            meters. The closing date for project will be extended from
            June 15, 2011 until June 15, 2012. This will be the third
            extension of the project closing date. The extension of the
            project allowed to increase subscriptions to the water
            network thereby improving the collections rate, and to
            strengthen the Bekaa Region Water Authority's
            (BRWA's) technical and managerial capacity by retaining
            the technical assistance provided by the project management
            unit and service operator.

display_title.display_title:
Lebanon - Ba'albeck Water
            and Wastewater Project : restructuring (Vol. 2) : Data sheet
